intro: Oenothera macrosceles, commonly known as the showy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, branching stems and large, showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces numerous seeds enclosed in a capsule, which is a common reproductive strategy among members of the Onagraceae family. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Oenothera macrosceles is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
